info.name: LicenseV4
info.description: User License API used for managing user licenses and related products. Supposed to be consumed by user client application.

request.description: Returns all products which are visible by user. All related product items are in the response, which can be used for grouping, sorting and showing product details.

response.name: Bad Request
Successful response

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the user to fetch licenses for.

request.description: Returns all active licenses for a given user. All related products are included in the response, which can be used for grouping.

response.name: Successful response
User does not exist
Unauthorized

header.description: (Required) Client unique generated value for server to recognize subsequent retries

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the user to create license for.

request.description: Creates new license associated with user and product

response.name: Successful response on created resource

header.description: (Required) Client unique generated value for server to recognize subsequent retries

response.name: Not Found

response.name: Incorrect PIN code

response.name: Bad Request

header.description: (Required) Client unique generated value for server to recognize subsequent retries

query.description: Return only licenses which belongs to specified user id.
Return only licenses which were purchased with specified payment method. 'none' is a reserved word for selecting records which has no set payment_method (i.e. null in DB)
Return only licenses which were purchased after specified date. Full-date notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6
Return only licenses which belongs to specificied product id.

Comma separated relationships to be included. Currently supported relationships - product. Follows behaviour described at [Inclusion of Related Resources](https://jsonapi.org/format/1.1/#fetching-includes)

request.description:
Returns a list of licenses for a given input set of filters. All related users are included in the response, the inclusion of related products is controlled by 'include' parameter.
The endpoint returd 100 results per page.

request.description:
Use this request to obtain Bearer token which then can be used with later requests to real server.
You need to add tocken under Authorisation tab, select "Bearer token" and use access_token from response.
